Description: Floor and flaring foot of South Ionian pottery cup, probably a cup with everted rim; wholly glazed save underside; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the ring foot and slip find parallels with his South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 5 or Type 9. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18). The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. Type 5 cups are few at Naukratis whereas there are numerous examples of Type 9 cups. Both types were common drinking vessels found in Greeks sanctuaries, including the sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus and the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. The number 167 is written in ink on the underside of the foot.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 167)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 656, no. 128)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.117) (Phase 3)
